question: What is a static field in Java?
options: A) A field that belongs to a single instance of a class.
B) A field that belongs to the class itself, not to any instance.
C) A field that can only be accessed within the same package.
D) A field that is automatically initialized to zero.
answer: B) A field that belongs to the class itself, not to any instance.

What is the purpose of the static keyword in Java?
options: A) To create a constant value.
B) To define a method that belongs to the class, not to any instance.
C) To prevent a class from being instantiated.
D) To allow a method to access instance fields.
answer: B) To define a method that belongs to the class, not to any instance.

question: What is the output of the following code?
Which of the following is true about static methods?
options: A) They can access instance fields directly.
B) They can only access static fields.
C) They can be overridden in subclasses.
D) They are called using the instance name.
answer: B) They can only access static fields.

Which of the following is true about static fields?
options: A) They are shared among all instances of the class.
B) They are unique to each instance of the class.
C) They can only be accessed within the same package.
D) They are automatically initialized to null.
answer: A) They are shared among all instances of the class.

question: What is the output of the following code?
Which of the following is true about static methods?
options: A) They can access instance variables directly.
B) They can be overridden in subclasses.
C) They are called using the class name.
D) They are used to create instance-specific behavior.
answer: C) They are called using the class name.

question: What is the output of the following code?
Which of the following is true about static fields?
options: A) They are initialized to zero by default.
B) They are unique to each instance of the class.
C) They can only be accessed within the same package.

answer: A) They are initialized to zero by default.
